intro: Adinandra integerrima var. nigropunctata, commonly known as the black-punctured adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Mozambique. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves with distinctive black dots, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its fruits are small, spherical berries. This species is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests.
